paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The variant TTR is already present in nine symptom-free children with the mean serum level of 11.90 mg/dl.
but it is not present in 15 other children.

functional_data.summary: The variant TTR can be measured in serum and is associated with FAP.

variants.segregation_data: The variant TTR is present in affected individuals and absent in unaffected family members.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the importance of early diagnosis and genetic counseling.
key_quotes: The variant TTR is already present in nine symptom-free children with the mean serum level of 11.90 mg/dl.
The variant TTR is not present in 100 normal individuals, in four cases of primary and six cases of secondary amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was successfully extracted.
